prompts.title: PDF Styling Best Practices
prompts.description: Best practices for creating well-styled PDFs with write_pdf tool
prompts.prompt:
# PDF Styling Best Practices for write_pdf ## PDF Options (Landscape, Page Size) Use `options` parameter with `pdf_options` key: ``` options: {"pdf_options": {"format": "A4", "landscape": true, "margin": {"top": "0", "left": "0", "right": "0", "bottom": "0"}, "printBackground": true}} ``` Supported options: - `format`: 'A4', 'Letter', 'Legal', etc. - `landscape`: true/false - `margin`: {top, right, bottom, left} - use "0" for edge-to-edge - `printBackground`: true (required for background colors!) ## Full-Page Slides (Multi-Page Decks) For slide decks with full-page backgrounds, use `height: 100vh` with `box-sizing: border-box`: ```html

Slide Title

Content here

Next Slide

``` This fills the entire page with no white gaps at bottom. ## Layout - Use Tables, Not Flexbox CSS flexbox often breaks in PDF rendering. Use HTML tables for multi-column layouts: ```html
Column 1 Column 2
``` ## Page Breaks - Use explicit: `
` - Place between slide divs, not inside them - Content splits unpredictably without explicit breaks ## Rounded Corners on Headers Negative margins break border-radius. Use a container: ```html
Header content
``` ## Reliable Card Pattern ```html
Title
Description
``` ## Colors That Work Well Together - Dark gradient: `linear-gradient(135deg, #0f172a, #1e293b)` - Card backgrounds: `#f8fafc` (light gray), `#fef2f2` (light red) - Accent colors: `#6366f1` (indigo), `#10b981` (green), `#8b5cf6` (purple), `#f59e0b` (amber), `#ef4444` (red) - Text: `#0f172a` (dark), `#64748b` (muted) Apply these patterns for professional, well-rendered PDFs!
